results.title: The Cave community
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains why the relatively unchanging environment of caves provides biologists with important data. Shows the evolutionary and adaptive modifications of cave dwelling bats, fish, insects and salamanders.

results.title: The Cave: a parable told by Orson Welles
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow and Counterpoint Films
results.brief_description: An animated dramatization based on “The Allegory of the Cave” from Book 7 of Plato’s “Republic” illustrating mankind’s escape from the world of illusion to the world of reality. Four men chained in a cave take images reflected on a wall for the truth. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: Cavalcade of Australia
results.brief_description: On the celebration of Australia’s Jubilee as a Commonwealth, Australian film production organisations, both government and commercial, made available for this film archival material from their libraries. The film shows highlights of the important events of the first 50 years of the Federation. Music by Sydney John Kay.

results.title: [Caulfield Technical College Annual Review, 1966]
results.brief_description: An example of student film making. The surfer, riding a child’s tricycle with his surfboard under his arm, enters a park, splashes across an ornamental pond and land-surfs under a sprinkler. No title, no credits available.

results.title: Caulfield: a Living City
results.creator_credit: John Freney-Mills, Ewart Wade, Caulfield City Council and Caulfield Film Society
results.brief_description:
Weekend activities in the City of Caulfield. Schools, churches, sporting and social service groups keep the city alive at weekends. Activities include the running of the Caulfield Cup, and quieter games such as tennis and bowls. School children learn road safety at special classes and attend the Youth Centre. For the elderly citizens there are “meals-on-wheels”.

(11/2/19 CC) Selected highlights list from MP:

00:12:24:00 what appears to be St Aloysius Church with spire
00:12:44:00 Caulfield Park Conservatory and gardens

00:14:52:00 shot of Caulfield Technical College now Monash University (Caulfield campus) and students entering the front stair case

00:15:30:00 Caulfield South Pre-school

results.title: Caught shoplifting
results.brief_description: Explores and illustrates the economic issues as well as the human motivations behind the act of shoplifting: the desire for adventure; plain boredom; a feeling of alienation or a need to conform. The film does more than direct attention to the scope and social consequences of shoplifting. It focuses on the greatest need to examine our individual understanding of ethics and morality, and to avoid the near occasions of self-indulgence in theft.

results.title: Catuor
results.creator_credit: Judith Klein, Pierre Heberrt and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film is about cats - actually, one very clever cat. The title is a play on the French “quatuor” meaning quartet, but the chorus is not the usual alley cat variety. The cat in this film is talented indeed. It is both pianist and piano, trumpet and trumpeter, and, if need be, even becomes the music - a pulsing rock and roll - or a whole swarm of alley cats. Award: Madrid

results.title: A Cattleman's day
results.creator_credit: Ted Wilson and S A Film, Television and Laboratories
results.brief_description: A typical day in the life of a Central Australian stockman. Breaking camp in the early morning, saddling up a fresh horse and mustering half-wild cattle into a mob for sorting, counting and branding. The aboriginal stockmen are particularly adept. At the end of the day the cattle are turned loose and wander back to their familiar ground. Music by Isador Goodman.

results.title: Cattle trail
results.brief_description: Cattle on the Cascade Station in South Westland are rounded up twice yearly and taken on an arduous three weeks drive up the coast to the sale-yards at Wataroa. This film provides a record of the journey which traverses some of New Zealand’s finest forest, mountain, lake, river, and alpine scenery.

results.title: The Cattle carters
results.creator_credit: Derek Williams, Cinesound for British Petroleum and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: A dramatic account of road trains in outback Australia. Each year thousands of cattle are moved from the great cattle properties of north-west Australia to the railhead for shipment to southern and overseas markets. Today this journey is carried out as a round-the-clock enterprise operating 48 ton road trains over the tracks where drovers once rode for weeks at a time. Typical is the trail from Anna Plains to Meekatharra - the longest overland road haul of its type in Australia. (Diploma of Merit, 1962 Melbourne Film Festival).
